GI assaults S. Korean woman
Anecdote about Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
GI assaults S. Korean woman 
    Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- Amid GI crimes being reported one after another in South Korea, an American soldier did violence to a South Korean woman in Posan-dong, Tongduchon city, Kyonggi Province on December 31 last year, according to MBC of South Korea.
 He, a recruit of the first battalion of the 72nd tank unit of the U.S. second army division, drunk in the evening, assaulted and beat a woman surnamed Ri for no reason.    
 He said that he would make a statement only in the presence of a U.S. Government representative if he is asked to come to the South Korean police. Then he kept silent only to reveal his arrogance.

Anti-Americanism listed as one of internet ten-point news
Natural phenomena in Korea
articles.content:
Anti-Americanism listed as one of internet ten-point news 
    Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The Cyber Cultural Institute of South Korea made public the ten-point news of the internet for 2002 on December 31 last year, according to Seoul-based Yonhap News.
 The institute said that anti-Americanism escalated through internet in the year 2002 and citizens' activities turned into an full-scale social campaign, triggering off the candlelight demonstration at Kwanghwamun. Such anti-Americanism was placed at the top of the 10-point news events, it declared.
